about_department.description: The Morgan State University Computer Science Program is part of the School of Computer, Mathematics, and Natural Sciences. The program provides students with fundamental computer science knowledge and training, preparing them to apply their skills to solve real-world problems. Students learn problem definition, feasibility analysis, solution strategy development, design, implementation, testing, modification, documentation, and communication. The curriculum balances practical knowledge and theoretical foundations to support career readiness and adaptability in the evolving discipline.
degrees_offered: Bachelor of Science (BS) in Computer Science
Master of Science (MS) in Advanced Computing
Bachelor of Science (BS) in Cloud Computing

contact_information.address: 1700 E Cold Spring Lane, Baltimore, MD 21251, McMechen 507 Suite

professors.name: Mohamed Eltoweissy
professors.title: Professor, Associate Dean for Research and Graduate Programs

professors.name: Roshan Paudel
professors.title: Coordinator of the MS in Bioinformatics Program, Professor of Practice

engineers_in_residence.description: Every Fall Semester, there is a Google Engineer in Residence through the Google in Residence (GIR) program. Launched in 2013, this program aims to increase diversity in the tech industry by partnering with Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) and Hispanic-Serving Institutions (HSIs). Experienced Googlers teach introductory computer science courses and provide career guidance.

research_areas: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning / Deep Learning

student_organizations.name: Women In Computer Science (WiCS)
student_organizations.mission: Supporting and empowering female students in computer science through networking, mentorship, and community building.

student_organizations.name: Google Developer Student Club (GDSC)
student_organizations.description: A student-run organization supported by Google that bridges the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world application in technology.

student_organizations.name: Society for the Advancement of Computer Science (SACS)
student_organizations.mission: Promoting the advancement of computer science through discussions, technical events, and industry collaboration.
